
# Media Link Examples

Opens link

[link text](http://dev.nodeca.com)

[link with title](http://nodeca.github.io/pica/demo/ "title text!")

Custom - opens link in a new window / tab

(link new tab)(_blank)(https://google.com)

Links can be base64 although struggles with some types like svg. This is the ideal solution for encrypted files as this embed the raw image into the text file. Raw links are just pointers and the source is not encrypted. However the file can get big and more difficult to manage.

![logo](data:image/png;base64,)

## Embedding Images, Videos, Spreadsheets, Powerpoint, PDFs, Twitch, VOD, anything that likes an iframe ...

![Minion](https://octodex.github.com/images/minion.png)

![Stormtroopocat](https://octodex.github.com/images/stormtroopocat.jpg "The Stormtroopocat")

Like links, Images also have a footnote style syntax

![Alt text][id]

With a reference later in the document defining the URL location:

[id]: https://octodex.github.com/images/dojocat.jpg  "The Dojocat"
